Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2025 #238

Condolences to the family of Willia L. Bullock.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, DSSponsors:Mayor E. Denise Simmons
Category:Death Resolution

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

The City Council was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of Willia L. Bullock, beloved mother of Bernice Taylor, a dedicated member of the City Clerk’s office, on October 16, 2025 at the age of 89; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Born in Roberta, Georgia, on November 19, 1935, to the late Willie and Bessie Banks, Willia brought her southern warmth to Boston as a young girl, and it was in Boston where she met and married her lifelong partner, Richard Bullock Sr., with whom she shared nearly 72 years of marriage; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

A devoted wife, mother, grandmother, and great-grandmother, Willia Bullock was a faithful member of Mt. Calvary Baptist Church, where she served with humility and grace as a Deaconess, Missionary, and choir member, and was known for her generous spirit, quick wit, and unforgettable tea biscuits; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Willia’s life was a testament to unconditional love, patience, resilience, joy, and compassion—qualities she instilled in all of her children, and in all whose lives she touched; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Willia was preceded in death by several of her siblings and her beloved son Charles “Charlie” Bullock, she leaves to cherish her memory her husband Richard, her children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren, and an extended family and community who will forever hold her in their hearts; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record extending its deepest condolences to Bernice Taylor and the entire family of Willia L. Bullock for their tremendous loss; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to Bernice Taylor on behalf of the entire City Council.
